Text_Numeracy: I am someone who rarely goes to the doctor, but recently (230-234), I took an international flight to South Asia. Prior to traveling, I visited a travel clinic in order to recieve immunizations, as well as preventative medications , for various diseases which are prominent in South Asia (i.e malaria).  A week after returning home, I developed a fever. As a precaution, I took my own blood and urine samples at home (with the help of at-home tests), and then sent them off to an online lab service. I also used a specialized malaria microscope slide in order to check for malaria parasites in my own blood. It turned out, I had a strep infection, and not malaria, and the medical services I discovered were the reason why I was able to quickly seek medical attention.  Using the at-home tests and online lab service for blood and urine samples allowed me to discover that I had a medical issue that needed immediate attention.
